feed.title: SAP Community - ABAP Development
feed.subtitle: ABAP Development Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: CL_ABAP_PARALLEL - Fire and forget scenario with an OData implementation/Any object
entry.content:
Hello Team,

I have a usecase where a expensive process have to be pushed in background using CL_ABAP_PARALLEL.
System: S4hana 2022 onpremise
i used run/ run_inst but it waits for all the work process to finish. I could see "START_INST_IN_BACKGROUND" but i am not sure this will server the purpose.

My OData caller is expecting the response immediately and time consuming process should process in background


Note: we are looking for a released api.. clean core journey it is!!!

Regards,
Vishnu

entry.title: MARD and MARC table delta with ABAP CDS Extractor (CDC Enabled) does not work
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

The tables MARC and MARD have a replacement objects in S4HANA. When a ABAP CDS view extractor (CDC enabled) is built on these tables , we have observed that the delta does not work if the record is changed but New records are coming as delta.

How do we handle delta for these tables ? Or do we have any alternate way to get the delta from table MARC and MARD in Datasphere.

Thanks,

Vinay

entry.title: RAP Behavior extension (action with parameter)
entry.content:
Hi everyone, we've been trying to suppress the parameter in this action in a standard BDEF out of the F3893 Manage Sales Order app:

static default factory action CreateWithSalesOrderType parameter D_SalesOrderCreateP [1];

Metadata extension is not allowed and so far we have not found a way (or maybe the right syntax) to do it in the behavior extension. Ideally we would override the action and remove the parameter. An option would be to set the parameters with the defaultvalue annotation and hide it (hoping that would suppress the popup when pressing "Create" in the Fiori App). Anyone has an idea ?

entry.title: HTML Email Logo Not Displayed in SAP GUI 8.00 (Displays Correctly in SAP 7.70 and External Client)
entry.content:
Dear community,

We are currently facing an issue related to the rendering of HTML email content in SAP GUI version 8.00. Specifically, the problem occurs in transaction SOST when viewing an email sent using CL_BCS and HTML content that includes a company logo via an external image URL (hosted publicly).

Issue Summary:
In SAP GUI 7.70, the HTML content displays correctly in transaction SOST, including the externally hosted image (logo).

In external email clients (such as Outlook or Gmail), the image is also displayed correctly.

However, in SAP GUI 8.00, the logo does not appear when viewing the same email via transaction SOST. The rest of the HTML content is shown, but the <img src="..."> element is not rendered.

This leads us to believe the issue is related to how SAP GUI 8.00 handles rendering external image resources within HTML emails.

Questions for SAP:
Has SAP GUI 8.00 introduced new security restrictions or rendering limitations related to external image content (e.g., CSP-like behavior, sandboxing, or blocked external links)?

Is this a known limitation or change in design?

Is there any way to restore the previous behavior or workaround this limitation (e.g., configuration parameters, registry settings, or recommended alternative using embedded images)?

Could SAP provide a Note or guidance regarding this rendering difference?

Here’s my example code: 

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_recipient,
email TYPE ad_smtpadr,
express TYPE os_boolean,
copy TYPE os_boolean,
blind_copy TYPE os_boolean,
no_forward TYPE os_boolean,
END OF ty_recipient.

DATA: html_body TYPE soli_tab,
temp_line(255) TYPE c,
mail_subject TYPE so_obj_des,
return_msg TYPE bapiret1,
recipients TYPE TABLE OF ty_recipient,
recipient_line TYPE ty_recipient.

CLEAR: html_body.

" Build subject line.
mail_subject = 'example subject'.

DATA(logo_url) = |https://example.png|.

" Build HTML body
APPEND '<!DOCTYPE html>' TO html_body.
APPEND '<html lang="en">' TO html_body.
APPEND '<head>' TO html_body.
APPEND '<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8"/>' TO html_body.
APPEND '</head>' TO html_body.
APPEND '<body>' TO html_body.
APPEND |<img src="{ logo_url }" alt="Logo" />| TO html_body.
APPEND '</body>' TO html_body.
APPEND '</html>' TO html_body.

recipient_line-email = 'test@test.com'.
APPEND recipient_line TO recipients.

IF html_body IS NOT INITIAL.

DATA: message_text TYPE string,
sent_success TYPE os_boolean,
email_address TYPE ad_smtpadr.

DATA: sender_ref TYPE REF TO if_sender_bcs,
bcs_exception TYPE REF TO cx_bcs,
send_request TYPE REF TO cl_bcs,
document_ref TYPE REF TO cl_document_bcs,
recipient_ref TYPE REF TO if_recipient_bcs.

FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_recipient> TYPE ty_recipient.

IF recipients IS INITIAL.
MESSAGE e079(so) INTO return_msg-message.
return_msg-id = sy-msgid.
return_msg-type = sy-msgty.
return_msg-number = sy-msgno.
return_msg-message_v1 = sy-msgv1.
return_msg-message_v2 = sy-msgv2.
return_msg-message_v3 = sy-msgv3.
return_msg-message_v4 = sy-msgv4.
RETURN.
ENDIF.

IF mail_subject IS INITIAL.
MESSAGE e368(00) WITH 'Please provide subject' 'for the email' INTO return_msg-message.
return_msg-id = sy-msgid.
return_msg-type = sy-msgty.
return_msg-number = sy-msgno.
return_msg-message_v1 = sy-msgv1.
return_msg-message_v2 = sy-msgv2.
return_msg-message_v3 = sy-msgv3.
return_msg-message_v4 = sy-msgv4.
RETURN.
ENDIF.

DATA html_service TYPE REF TO cl_gbt_multirelated_service.
CREATE OBJECT html_service.

CALL METHOD html_service->set_main_html
EXPORTING
content = html_body
filename = 'sapwebform.htm'
description = 'Logo'.

TRY.
document_ref = cl_document_bcs=>create_from_multirelated(
i_subject = mail_subject
i_multirel_service = html_service ).

send_request = cl_bcs=>create_persistent( ).
send_request->set_document( i_document = document_ref ).

LOOP AT recipients ASSIGNING <fs_recipient>.
email_address = <fs_recipient>-email.
recipient_ref = cl_cam_address_bcs=>create_internet_address( email_address ).
send_request->add_recipient(
EXPORTING
i_recipient = recipient_ref
i_express = <fs_recipient>-express
i_copy = <fs_recipient>-copy
i_blind_copy = <fs_recipient>-blind_copy
i_no_forward = <fs_recipient>-no_forward ).
ENDLOOP.

sent_success = send_request->send( i_with_error_screen = 'X' ).

COMMIT WORK.

IF sent_success IS INITIAL.
MESSAGE e098(so) INTO return_msg-message.
return_msg-id = sy-msgid.
return_msg-type = sy-msgty.
return_msg-number = sy-msgno.
return_msg-message_v1 = sy-msgv1.
return_msg-message_v2 = sy-msgv2.
return_msg-message_v3 = sy-msgv3.
return_msg-message_v4 = sy-msgv4.
RETURN.
ELSE.
MESSAGE s022(so) INTO return_msg-message.
return_msg-id = sy-msgid.
return_msg-type = sy-msgty.
return_msg-number = sy-msgno.
return_msg-message_v1 = sy-msgv1.
return_msg-message_v2 = sy-msgv2.
return_msg-message_v3 = sy-msgv3.
return_msg-message_v4 = sy-msgv4.
RETURN.
ENDIF.

CATCH cx_bcs INTO bcs_exception.
message_text = bcs_exception->if_message~get_text( ).
MESSAGE e865(so) WITH message_text INTO return_msg-message.
return_msg-id = sy-msgid.
return_msg-type = sy-msgty.
return_msg-number = sy-msgno.
return_msg-message_v1 = sy-msgv1.
return_msg-message_v2 = sy-msgv2.
return_msg-message_v3 = sy-msgv3.
return_msg-message_v4 = sy-msgv4.
ENDTRY.

IF return_msg-type = 'S'.
" Success.
ELSE.
" Error.
ENDIF.

ENDIF.

entry.title: Do not display deleted line item in sap adobe form output using SAP S4 using Gateway service
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am using SAP gateway service to develope SAP ADOBE form using the interface i want to omit the deleted line item in form output.

I am following the below steps to produce form output.

1. Create PO with 3 line items and save it.

2. Delete 1 line item from the PO and approve it using the Front End and corresponding output is generated in which i have omited    the deleted line item so the output contains 2 line items.

3. Now i change the PO after apprval and delete another line item this time for the change po i should get only the recently deleted line item in the Change PO output i.e only 2 line items.

Could you please let me know from which table in SAP S4 could i use to add logic.

entry.title: Logic For Item in Grouping
entry.content:
I’ve been assigned to modify a program where the requirement is to display Profit Center and its corresponding Profit Center Name, under specific conditions.

Business Rule:

Group the data by FI Document Number (BELNR) first, then apply logic to retrieve the correct Profit Center Name based on the Profit Center values within the same document group.

Scenarios:

Case 1:
If all Profit Centers in the group share the same first 4 digits, strip the remaining digits of trailing zeros and use that to retrieve the Profit Center Name.

Case 2:
If the Profit Centers share the same first 2 digits, strip the rest of the digits of trailing zeros and retrieve the Profit Center Name.

Case 3:
If the Profit Centers are completely identical, then directly retrieve the Profit Center Name using that value.

Issue I’m Facing:

Right now, the program logic is executed per line item, which means it cannot determine if Profit Centers within the same FI Document group are similar or different. Therefore, it's difficult to apply the rules above correctly at the group level.

I would appreciate any suggestions or advice on how best to restructure or enhance the logic — especially how to compare Profit Center values across grouped FI Documents in ABAP, or whether you’ve handled a similar requirement before.

Thank you in advance 🙏

entry.title: How to Make Attachment Mandatory Before Saving in VA01 (Sales Order Creation)?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

One of my clients has a requirement to make it mandatory to attach a document before saving a sales order in VA01 and VA02.

I successfully implemented the check in VA02 by using the USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE in MV45AFZZ, where the sales order number is already available, and I could restrict the save based on the attachment check.

However, in VA01, since the sales order number is generated only after saving, I'm unable to validate whether an attachment is present before the document is saved.

Has anyone faced a similar scenario?
Is there a way to check for attachments or enforce this validation in VA01 before the sales order is created?
Any BADI or User Exit suggestions or workaround approaches would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

Best regards,

Mannem Leelamohan

i am using SAP GW service to develope the adobe form

Thanks

entry.title: To update REGUH-VALUDT based on individual invoice item amount REGUP-WRBTR <10k during F110
entry.content:
My requirement is to update REGUH-VALUDT for individual invoice item i.e REGUP-BELNR based on REGUP-WRBTR < 10k . This is during payment proposal. I have tried to implement BTE 1830 , but that does not trigger for each line item , hence could not use it.

Can someone suggest alternative BTE/Exits/BADI in SAP S/4 HANA on premise 1909 version which will fufill the above ask.

entry.title: deleting/moving PPM project tasks in the Completed status
entry.content:
Hello,

In a Maintanance project, sometimes I need to delete or move a Task around in the project structure but after getting the Completed status all changes are prohibited. We have ChaRM and PPM integration set up.
1. Can I customize the status scheme so that the Completed status can be canceled? I can't find such settings in spro.
2. Is there any report that allows deleting different tasks without archiving the whole project?

Any input is greatly appreciated.

Thank you )

entry.title: WorkCenter ALE IDOC Error - The (internal) unit HUR has not been maintained in the unit table
entry.content:
Hi all,

I'm currently working on ALE distribution of work centers from our DEV system to the QAS system. I've completed the necessary ALE configurations, including:

  • Sending System 

    • Message type: LOIWCS

    • IDoc type: LOIWCS03 (outbound)

  • Receiving System
    • Message type: LOIWCS

    • Inbound process code: WRKCTR,

    • linked to function module CR_IDOC_WRKCENTER_INBOUND

The IDoc is being triggered correctly using transaction POIM, but the work center is not being created in the receiving system. The issue arises because:

  • The fields KAPEH and MEINS in segment E1KAKOL are populated with the ISO code for the commercial unit of measure (UoM) HR. HR is maintained in the capacity UoM via CR03

  • However, the LEINH field in E1CRCOL (for work center cost data) is populated with the internal standard UoM

This ISO code UOM causes a KAKO UoM error during processing. I'm struggling to understand why there's a difference in how UoMs are handled between the capacity (CRCO) and cost (KAKO) structures, especially since:

  • The outbound and inbound IDoc field values are identical

  • CUNI settings are aligned in both systems

Has anyone experienced similar behavior or can provide detailed technical guidance on resolving this inconsistency?

Any insights would be greatly appreciated.

#ale, #workcenter, #LOIWCS, 

Best regards,

entry.title: ABAP RAP - Date field value help with future dates disabled?
entry.content:
Hello SAP ABAP RAP Experts,

Is it possible to disable the future dates in the value help of a date field in SAP RAP application?

For example, if today is 22nd July 2025, the value help should show the future dates, i.e. 22nd July onwards as greyed out/disabled and therefore not allowing the user to select future dates.

Just FYI. We are currently handling this requirement based on a validation on save. Is there any other efficient way of handling this?

Thanks!

entry.title: ABAP unit test coverage not work for CONSTRUCTOR
entry.content:
There is some logic in CONSTRUTOR method of my class, So I wrote some unit test for creating instance

1. The unit tests all passed successful, no dump

2. Debugging for the UT can run into break-point of CONSTRUCTOR method.

3. Other instance method UT coverage works good.

the problem is , the UT coverage of CONSTRUTOR method always 0%, anyone met this problem?

UT code like:

CLASS ltd_test DEFINITION FOR TESTING
  DURATION SHORT
  RISK LEVEL HARMLESS
  INHERITING FROM zcl_data.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    DATA: mo_tool_double TYPE REF TO zif_data_tool.

    METHODS: setup

    METHODS: constructor_test FOR TESTING.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS ltd_test IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD setup.
    mo_tool_double ?= cl_abap_testdouble=>create( 'zif_data_tool' ).

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD constructor_test .
    cl_abap_testdouble=>configure_call( mo_tool_double )->ignore_all_parameters( )->and_expect( )->is_called_once( ).
    mo_tool_double->get_data(  ).

    DATA lo_c TYPE REF TO zcl_data.

    CREATE OBJECT lo_c 
          EXPORTING io_double = mo_tool_double.


    cl_abap_testdouble=>verify_expectations( mo_tool_double ).
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

entry.title: Issue with Missing Records in CDS Table Function (ABAP 7.50 / HANA)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m hoping someone here can help me with a problem I’m facing.

I’ve been asked to provide data for a report that should show the date of the last document for each customer. I planned to implement this using a CDS view. However, since we are still on ABAP release 7.50, I don’t have access to the latest CDS View features.

To work around this, I tried using a CDS Table Function to retrieve the data. Unfortunately, I noticed that some records are missing. When I run the same SELECT statement in the SQL Console, I get a result for a specific customer – but that same record is not returned by the Table Function.

The data does exist in the underlying tables, so I’m wondering:
Why is the record not returned by the Table Function?

I’m aware that there are differences between Open SQL and SQLScript used in Table Functions, but I would have expected the Table Function to return at least the same or more data – not less.

We are running ABAP 7.50 on a HANA database.

OpenSQL:

SQLScript:

 

 

Any ideas or explanations would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: E:SDDL_PARSER_MSG:542 PROVIDER CONTRACT 785
entry.content:
I have developed Root view and on top of which I want to define Projection View, But I encouter error as  E:SDDL_PARSER_MSG:542 PROVIDER CONTRACT 785 , help me to fix this issue. Iam on S4 2020.

@EndUserText.label: 'Projection View for Holiday Block'

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true

@Search.searchable: true

define root view entity ZHLD_CUST_BLOCK_C

provider contract transactional_query

as projection on ZHOLIDAY_BLOCK_ROOT

{

key Customer,

key Salorg,

key DistChn,

key Div,

CustomerName1,

CustomerName2,

CustDelBlock,

Text,

StartDate,

EndDate

}

entry.title: Changing Post Processing in DMEE
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm currently working on adapting DMEE format to align with the new ISO 20022 requirements, specifically for the CGI_XML_CT_V9 format. However, I'm encountering a blocking issue related to post processing of empty XML elements in the DMEE tree.

We are implementing the ISO pain 001.001.09 XML format, and during validation, the generated XML file fails.

I attempted to modify the Post Processing settings in the DMEE tree to adjust how empty elements are handled. The goal is to completely remove empty elements.

I followed these instructions: 3480644 - DMEE/DMEEX: XML Empty Element Processing

However, here's the issue:

  • I change the setting, save it, and activate the DMEE tree.

  • But every time I reopen the DMEE tree, the setting reverts back to “DO NOT REMOVE” – the change doesn't persist.

This means my XML output is still invalid, and I cannot move forward with the bank's required format.

Has anyone experienced this rollback issue in the DMEE post processing settings?

 Any guidance would be greatly appreciated. 

Thanks in advance!
